column1: This sheet drives the AI spatial reasoning engine: site zone assignments, material staging, equipment placement, conflict flags

column10: Spatial Priority Note
Establish single entry/exit point at north
Clear full site sightlines required
Keep north edge clear for utility trucks
Dump truck route: East access road. Spoil pile must not block crane zone
Continuous truck queue needed. Route: South entry → pump → exit East
Rebar bundles heavy — stage adjacent to footprint south side
Small materials — store inside future footprint boundary
PEAK concrete day. All other deliveries STOP. Full site access for trucks
Forklift must access all wall faces. Stage blocks per elevation to minimise carries
Vigas up to 20ft long. West staging must be clear 30ft. Overhead clearance critical
Crane critical – position South-Center to reach all roof zones
Crane still active. No material staging under crane swing arc
Materials stored inside – protect from weather
HVAC units heavy. Stage North – away from active block work
Coordinate with plumber – no ceiling conflict
BBQ + fireplace gas lines. Pressure test before close-up
Scaffold around full perimeter. Worker path: perimeter walkway only
HEAVIEST roof load. Stage East – crane lifts to roof. Do NOT stage under eave
Small area – stage directly adjacent to work zone
West courtyard enclosed – materials must enter via West gate
3 separate pour areas: front portal, rear portal, drives
Lightweight. Store inside. No conflict
Type X fire rated for garage. Keep dry
Interior scaffold conflicts with flooring crew – sequence carefully
Must acclimatise ON SITE 72hrs before install. Stage inside Week 14
Deliver after plaster dry. Sequence: cabs → tile → plumbing trim
Wet trade – allow 48hr cure before traffic
Install LAST in bedroom sequence after all other trades done
Protect hardwood during stone install
Fixtures fragile – deliver just-in-time Week 17
Panel energised this week – safety protocols
SEQUENCE CRITICAL: paint before trim, after tile
Final cabinet item – after all appliances rough positioned
All trades complete before clean begins
Certificate of Occupancy. All systems commissioned and tested
